meanings.definition: A person or business that sells poultry.
meanings.sent1: The poulterers at the market had a variety of chickens and ducks for sale.
meanings.sent2: The local poulterers always have fresh eggs and turkey during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The poulterers decided to have a chicken dance-off to attract more customers.
meanings.sent4: The poulterers' shop was a bustling hub of clucks and feathers.
meanings.sent5: The poulterers' colorful display of plump birds caught the eye of many passersby.

meanings.sent1: The poulterers in the town were known for their high-quality poultry products.
meanings.sent2: I visited the poulterers to buy some fresh chicken and quail.
meanings.sent3: The poulterers gathered for their annual feast, each bringing a different bird.
meanings.sent4: The poulterers' market stall was a symphony of clucks and squawks.
meanings.sent5: The poulterers' sign proudly displayed 'Fresh Poultry Daily' in bold letters.
